definition: enemy/to be a match for/to rival/to resist/to withstand

sentences.english: It's the glorious duty for every soldier to defend our country against enemies.
sentences.chinese: 衛國抗敵是每個士兵應盡的光榮職責。

sentences.english: When the armies of fascism swept Asia, We fought with you to stop them.
sentences.chinese: 法西斯軍隊席捲亞洲的時候，我們和你們並肩抗敵。

sentences.english: The army defied the enemy's forces.
We need to prepare for an emergency.
sentences.chinese: 不管怎麼說，我們需要爲抗敵做準備。

definition: United Front (either of the two alliances between the Guomindang and the Communist Party, 1923-1927 and 1937-1945)
to forfeit sovereignty and humiliate the country (idiom)/to surrender territory under humiliating terms
Autumn Harvest Uprising (1927), insurrection in Hunan and Jiangxi provinces led by Mao Zedong
the Mukden or Manchurian Railway Incident of 18th September 1931 used by the Japanese as a pretext to annex Manchuria/also known as Liutiaogou incident 柳條溝事變|柳条沟事变
Chen Jiongming (1878-1933), a leading warlord of Guangdong faction, defeated in 1925 and fled to Hong Kong
fire of war everywhere (idiom); enveloped in the flames of war
